caption:
I was in the mood for a sour, but wanted to do something different from the traditional whiskey. I'd say this came out very well!

'Tequila Sour'
2.0 oz reposado tequila
0.75 oz fresh squeezed lemon juice 
0.5 oz fresh squeezed lime juice
1.0 oz agave nectar

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain out ice. Add egg white. Shake. Shake. Shake. Dump into a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon wheel and a lime wheel.

#tequila #sour #eggwhites #lemonlime #mexelente #reverseshake #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad Paid Post

This weekend, we're doing a James Bond marathon, so it's only appropriate that I amassed the ingredients for the 'Vesper Martini'. This is the drink Ian Flemming created in his original 007 novel ("Casino Royale"). He specifies what gin and what fortified wine to use, but leaves the vodka open for the imagination. ....I decided to use the awesome @dentedbrickdistillery vodka and it makes quite a delightful cocktail!

'The Vesper Martini'
3.0 oz gin
1.0 oz Dented Brick vodka
0.5 oz Lillet Blanc

Add ingredients over ice. Stir (I'm sorry, I couldn't bring myself to shake it). Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

Thanks to @teamcraftedpour for making this happen.

#ClassicCocktail #Martini #007 #JamesBond #ShakenNotStirred #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

#ad Paid Post

I remember, when my sister and I were young, we'd get so excited when our parents let us order 'Shirley Temples' at a restaurant to celebrate something. Today's post uses one of the incredible grape nectars from @domainesante in a rif of this classic mocktail. I replaced grenadine with Bored-O Rouge nectar which comes from cabernet, merlot, and malbec grapes and provides "jammy" flavor with "berry and currant aromas". To me, this is really the grapey-est of the batch.

'Sant√© Temple'
0.75 oz Bored-O Rouge
0.5 oz ginger syrup
2.0 oz still water

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a hurricane glass packed with ice. Top with seltzer. Give a light stir. Garnish with an orange slice, maraschino cherries, and a tiny umbrella.

Don't forget to use the code "CraftedPour15" when you check out with a cart full of your own grape nectar for a 15% discount. And thanks to @teamcraftedpour for making this happen.

#memories #grapenectar #grapes #mocktail #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

Today's cocktail is inspired by the dill and lemon pepper aroma of this vodka from @dentedbrickdistillery . There's a lot going on in here, but the vodka holds up and creates a really nice backdrop for the drink. It's light and refreshing, perfect for a Saturday when the best thing is to sit by the pool and drink cocktails.

'Summer Saturday'
2.0 oz vodka
0.75 oz elderflower liqueur
0.5 oz green @chartreuse_uk 
0.5 oz honey syrup

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with lemon twist.

Thanks again to @teamcraftedpour for making this happen!

#vodka #elderflowerliqueur #chartreuse #honey #summercocktail #coupeglass #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

My second drink with the incredible grape nectars from @domainesante uses their All-Sass. This comes from gewurztraminer and riesling grapes. It has spice and I find a little earthiness to it. It's really incredible how different it tastes from the others. I decided to use it in a vieux carr√© riff, replacing the vermouth. Yes, I see the humor in using the only nectar that doesn't involve French grapes in a drink with a French name, but it came out really well!

'Vieux Gar-ape'
1.5 oz rye whiskey 
1.5 oz brandy
1.0 oz All-Sass
0.25 oz @benedictineliqueur
2 dashes @angosturahouse bitters 
1 dash absinthe

Add all ingredients over ice. Give it a long, slow stir. Strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice. Garnish with cherries.

Thanks again to @teamcraftedpour for making this possible!

#rye #whiskey #brandy #vieuxcarre #grapenectar #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #originaldrink #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

My first drink with the vodka from @dentedbrickdistillery is pretty original. My time in Scandinavia helped me accrue a taste for aquavit and I've been playing with replacing vermouth for cognac. The creamy and fruity flavors of the vodka work nicely with these two spirits. I'm not sure how often a drink is made with ingredients from France, Utah, and Norway, but this sure is a tasty one.

'The F.U.N. Martini'
2.0 oz vodka
0.75 oz @linieaquavit_official
0.75 oz @grandmarnierusa

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with an orange twist.

Thanks again to @teamcraftedpour for making this happen!

#aquavit #cognac #fun #martini #vodka #orange #caraway #mydrink #originaldrink #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

The first cocktail from my collaboration with @domainesante uses their "Bored-O Blanc" nectar. This comes from sauvignon blanc and s√©millon grapes. The official tasting notes describe it as "tangy with apple, fig, and candied citrus." I also get a bit of a spiced flavor from it, so that inspired me to use it in a daiquiri riff with spiced rum. It also pairs really nicely with the citrus from the lime and the peach bitters help with the overarching fruitiness.

'Blanquiri'
2.0 oz spiced rum 
1.25 oz bored-o blanc
1.0 oz fresh lime juice 
2 dashes peach bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Give a nice long shake. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

Thanks again to @teamcraftedpour for facilitating this partnership!

#grapes #grapenectar #sauvignonblanc #s√©millon #rum #daiquiri #lime #tastingnotes #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers  #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

The other day I got a request for a summer martini. I didn't have anything like that in my repertoire, so I mixed up something new, and it came out pretty tasty!

'Watermelon Martini'
1.0 oz gin
1.0 oz vodka
1.0 oz Grand Marnier
0.5-0.75 oz grenadine (depends how sweet your watermelon is)
1 hefty chunk watermelon

Muddle watermelon in a glass. Add ingredients and ice. Shake. Double strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a slice of watermelon.

Alright, as promised, here's my cocktail with the salted caramel whiskey from @knucklenoggin . It's a simple mix, but don't think that means the flavors aren't complex. I really wanted to highlight the whiskey, so I decided to stay away from piling things on top of it. It's a Manhattan riff, but I use dry vermouth to allow the sweetness of the caramel to take center stage.

'Knuckle Down'
3.0 oz Salted caramel whiskey #knucklenoggin
1.0 oz dry vermouth
1 dash saline solution
3 dashes toasted almond bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain over new ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with salt-dipped caramel pieces.

@theartofsippingpretty said, "cardamom bitters are the new aromatic bitters," and that got me to thinking. I took the recipe of @diffordsguide for a 'Queen's Park Hotel Super Cocktail' which makes prominent use of aromatic bitters, tweaked it a bit, and used cardamom bitters instead and it came out really well!!

'Cardamom Park Hotel'
2.0 oz aged rum
0.75 oz sweet vermouth
0.75 oz lime juice
0.5 oz grenadine
5 dashes cardamom bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into glass over new ice. Garnish with sour cherries.

#rum #cardamom #classiccocktails #vermouth #bitters #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers #sk√•l #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

I've had a craving for cardamom lately, so I got the bitters from #FeeBrothers and I made some syrup. Put them together with a splash of Irish whiskey for an old fashioned you'll not soon forget!

Syrup #recipe
1 C water
1 C white sugar
3 Tbsp crushed cardamom pods

Add ingredients to a pan over medium heat. Bring mixture to a rolling boil, stirring occasionally. Simmer for 5-10 min. Let cool. Place in a jar and store in the fridge for two days. Strain. Enjoy!

#cardamom #DIY #syrup #bitters #whiskey #oldfashionedcocktail #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers #sk√•l #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur #imbibegram

It's been SUPER cold lately, so I flipped open my "Spirit of the North" book by @selmasaur and looked to see what was in there for winter warmers. Here's a nice hot toddy (especially appropriate since Monday was National Hot Toddy Day)

'Odin's Gift'

Here's a drink I'm really excited to share with you. I've been looking for a good use for my Aztec Chocolate Bitters from @feebrothersbitters and discovered this. It's basically an Old Fashioned, but with brandy, so I don't know if that has a proper name. I have found that #christianbrothersbrandy is necessary to pull off maximum chocolate flavor. Let me know what you think.

3.0 oz brandy
1.0 oz Demerara syrup
3 dashes Aztec Chocolate Bitters

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain into a rocks glass over new ice. Garnish with a Lindor chocolate truffle.

This week's drink is a classic. Born in the French Quarter, the 'Vieux Carr√©' has been around since prohibition and it is a staple for mixologists. It should be noted that I stole this recipe from Amy over at @moodymixologist (I even stole the idea for the garnish)

1.0 oz cognac @cognacfrapinofficial
1.0 oz rye whiskey @heavenhilldistillery

Add ingredients over ice. Stir. Strain over fresh ice. Garnish with a @luxardoofficial cherry and a lemon twist.

#classiccocktail #vieuxcarre #whisky #congnac #vermouth #strongdrinks #maraschino #cocktails #drinks #MixedDrinks #Mixology #HomeBartender #HomeMixology #HappyHour #cheers #sk√•l #Alcohol #liquor #liqueur

Alright, this week's cocktail shouldn't come as a surprise given my recent post. At first, I was hesitant about the 'Hot Buttered Rum' because I felt like it was going to be too watered down, but it's actually fantastic. I highly recommend this drink to warm up the cold nights that are coming.

Sometimes, in lab, we make life-changing pharmaceuticals. Sometimes, we come up with cocktail recipes. Shout-out to @anthonytomaine for helping conceive the 'Bloody Napoleon'. We worked hard on this, so I hope you enjoy. It's cognac based (üá´üá∑), sweetened with Creole syrup (üá´üá∑ influenced), and has a float of Chartreuse (üá´üá∑). This concoction is a black pepper strawberry shrub. I got the recipe from @foodrepublic . It has a really nice balance and I've found a ton of fun uses. I actually made this batch back when strawberries were in season and froze it so I could enjoy some summer flavors this winter.

3/4 cup chopped ripe strawberries
3 tablespoons sugar
1 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper
1 cup white balsamic vinegar

Add everything except vinegar and let macerate for 30 min. Add vinegar and let sit in the fridge for 2 days. Strain and enjoy.

You know I'm getting back into the mixology groove when I have random jars sitting around making syrups and the like. This one here is a citrus cordial. I got the recipe from @selmasaur and I'm super excited to give it a try.

In her book "Spirit of the North", Selma writes:
1 C freshly-squeezed lemon juice
1 C freshly-squeezed orange juice
1 C superfine sugar

Mix well until sugar is completely dissolved, than add the peels of the oranges and lemons used for juicing. Let sit overnight at a minimum, with the peels of the oranges and lemons, but up to 2 days for the perfect yield. Strain before use.

First black pepper cocktail! I wanted to make black pepper infused whiskey but I kinda overdid it. It turns out 6 oz of whiskey to 1 tablespoon of black pepper corns is NOT the right ratio. That burned in a lot of ways. ...I could cut it though and it became drinkable. Here's a "Peppered Whiskey Sour"

1.0 oz black pepper infused whiskey
2.0 oz rye whiskey
0.5 oz lemon juice
0.5 oz lime juice
1.0 oz simple syrup
3 dashes of black pepper and cardamom bitters
1 egg white

Add ingredients, except for egg white, to a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain. Remove ice. Add egg white. Add mix back in. Shake HARD. Pour into rocks glass. Garnish with a grind of black pepper and a few drops of bitters.

So @barreloftiki is doing this event reminiscent of the use of secret ingredients in tiki drinks. I had to try it out. My secret ingredient is actually the spirit. It's a delicate combination of 3 different vodkas. One is made from wheat, one is made from sweet potatoes, one is made from apples. One adds spice, one adds body, one adds sweetness. It's a rather tricky mix to come by as I've only found one distillery (in NC) that makes the sweet potato and one distillery (in NY) which makes the apple, but then again, if a secret was easy, how much fun would that be?? I added some banana liqueur I had around and garnished with little plastic monkeys. Since this is supposed to be a barrel tiki drink, I call it 'Barrel of Monkeys'

2.5oz Secret Vodka Mix
0.5oz banana liqueur
0.5oz Cr√®me de Noyaux
1oz Falernum
2oz Pineapple juice
1dash black walnut bitters

Add ingredients together over ice. Stir. Strain. Garnish with a lemon wheel and plastic monkeys.

Inspired by the 21st amendment and a bad pun, this is my "Re-peel Day Sazerac"

Preparation:
Soak orange peel in cognac overnight.

Recipe:
2oz orange infused cognac
0.5oz @grandmarnierusa 
1cube sugar
2dashes orange bitters
2dashes absinthe

Method:
Rinse glass with 1dash absinthe. Add ice water and set aside. Soak sugar cube in 2dashes orange bitters and 1dash absinthe. Muddle. Add ice. Add cognac and Grand Marnier. Stir. Discard ice water from glass. Strain cocktail into glass over ice. Garnish with the orange peel that was used to flavor the cognac (repeal... re-peel.... Alright, stay with me for this one, because things are about to get weird! ....the other night I had a craving for a Ramos Gin Fizz. ... problem was: I didn't have any cream and hardly any gin. Happy Cinco de Mayo!! As I mentioned, a couple of us are doing a challenge to celebrate. We had to make a margarita that involves an exotic or tropical fruit. For my creation, I used Cucumis metuliferus, or kiwano. Also known as "horned melon" (it's also sometimes called "jelly melon," but that's much less badass). I made a shrub with it. This process extracted the flavors without having to worry about the weird texture of the fruit.

Shrub recipe:
8oz white vinegar
2oz apple balsamic vinegar
2oz @bullyhillvineyards red wine that I left sitting around too long (it's actually really good as a vinegar)
0.5 large horned melon contents
16oz Agave nectar

Add vinegars together and heat to almost boiling. Squeeze the contents of the melon into a jar. Pour vinegar mixture over melon. Seal and let sit for 1-4days. Add agave nectar and mix.

Drink recipe:
2oz Reposado tequila
2oz Horned Shrub
Juice of 1 lime

Add ingredients over ice. Shake. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with the husk of horned melon on fire!

Here's my entry for the March @homebarawards challenge. The topic: The Big Screen. A movie inspired cocktail. There's no movie that deserves a drink more than 'Citizen Kane'. Called "the most influential movie ever made" and "the #1 movie of all time," nominated for 9 academy awards and winner of Best Original Screenplay (1942), this film has withstood the test of time and still tops lists by USA today and IGN. I couldn't help but use the imagery, inspiration, and innovation to drive my cocktail.
---
The movie:
'Citizen Kane' follows the journey of reporter¬†Jerry Thompson (William Alland) as he tries to uncover the meaning of the final words of newspaper tycoon Charles Foster Kane (Orson Welles). Thompson follows Kane's troubled life from when his family became unexpectedly wealthy, to the building of his newspaper empire, through two marriages and subsequent divorces, to the raising of a castle, all concluding with his lonely final moments as he uttered his last word: "Rosebud." The film paints the portrait of a life corrupted by money, control, and an unsatisfied longing for something else.
---
The drink:
'Rosebud'
1 sugar cube
4-6 rose petals
1 bar spoon of rose syrup
2oz American whiskey 
Muddle sugar cube, rose petals, and rose syrup together. Add whiskey. Add ice and stir. Double strain into a glass over an ice ball (snow-globe) containing a rose.
---
The symbolism:
*The picture is grainy and black and white with dynamic lighting to mirror the film itself.
*The drink is a take-off of an Old Fashioned. The simplicity of the drink represents the simplicity of the life Charles Foster Kane longed for and had ripped away from him. His fortune, art, and prestige never made him content.
*The rose petals and syrup add the floral notes giving the drink its name: 'Rosebud'
*I chose American whiskey because, as the man himself¬†said: "I AM, HAVE BEEN, AND WILL BE ONLY ONE THING - AN AMERICAN."
*The garnish is a rose encased in a "snow-globe." These are the memories Kane yearns so much to have to fill his¬†cold and empty life.

#whiskey #rose #blackandwhite #CitizenKane #homebarawards #mixology #HomeBartender

Do it once, it's novel; do it twice, it's tradition. Here is the second year of Joe's Easter Limoncello. Limoncello is a great spring drink. Its light citrus flavor and bright color are the perfect match for warming weather and brightening sun. Also it's a great thing to bring to Easter dinner with the family.

Preparation:
-Peel 8 lemons. Be careful to get minimal pith (the white part on the back)
-Put peels in a bottle
-Fill bottle with 100 proof vodka (I used @mr.bostonofficial )
-Let sit for forty days and forty nights.
-Flip upside down, for shaking purposes, once a day or so
-Assemble two or more friends
-Add alcohol mixture, simple syrup, and water until desired flavor and consistency is reached

Celebrating my man @welcometomybar and his 10,000 followers (that's a lot of zeros!) My contribution to #fedes10ktikiparty is this bad boy. As I've said before, I don't have the appropriate tiki mug for this beverage, but I'm hoping my garnish game will make up for that. This is a boozy drink, so I'm calling it "The Tipsy Tiki"
-

When your 9yro kid is a picky eater, you make peanut butter and jelly for lunch. When you are a picky drinker, have my 'PB&J Martini' for happy hour! {Please note: @chemistry.cocktails does not approve of feeding 9 year old children martinis for lunch}

Bottom:
Your favorite jelly flavored liqueur (I chose black raspberry schnapps)

Top:
1.5oz cream
1.5oz vodka
2T peanut butter
1T sugar

Add all top ingredients in a shaker and shake. ....like really shake. ...like forget egg white level shaking, you need to shake this baby until your arm falls off and then have your friend help. Add ice and shake again (too much shaking WITH ice will dilute the drink). Pour your jelly layer into your glass, layer on your peanut butter layer.
